page.title: 04The Weybourne Village Hall
page.content: The new Village Hall was built in 1984, with a 75% grant from Surrey and Waverley council. The other 25% was raised by people living in the area. The hall has a timber frame which is surrounded by brick.The roof is covered with{Redland Tile.}On the inside the walls are covered in insulated plaster board.The land on which it is built is leased by Waverley for Â£600 per annum. Professional plumbers, bricklayers, heating engineers and electricians did most of the construction and fitting but the rest was done by village people. It is called a{Guildway Building and is used by many groups such as guides, jujitsu, baby clinic, Darby and Joans, bingo, ballet, dance, Sunday school and also for weddings, discos and parties.
